  7#ifndef VSIP_CORE_DENSE_STORAGE_HPP
  8#define VSIP_CORE_DENSE_STORAGE_HPP
  9
 10#include <vsip/support.hpp>
 11#include <vsip/core/storage.hpp>
 12#include <vsip/core/memory_pool.hpp>
 13
 14namespace vsip
 15{
 16namespace impl
 17{ 
 18
 19template <typename F, typename T>
 20class Dense_storage
 21{
 22public:
 23  typedef T*       type;
 24  typedef T const* const_type;
 25
 26  Dense_storage(Memory_pool*  pool,
 27		length_type   size,
 28		type          buffer = 0)
 29    VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc))
 30    : alloc_data_(!buffer),
 31      data_      (alloc_data_ ? pool->allocate<T>(size) : (T*)buffer)
 32  {}
 33
 34  Dense_storage(Memory_pool*  pool,
 35		length_type   size,
 36		T             val,
 37		type          buffer = 0)
 38  VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc))
 39    : alloc_data_(!buffer),
 40      data_      (alloc_data_ ? pool->allocate<T>(size) : (T*)buffer)
 41  {
 42    for (index_type i=0; i<size; ++i)
 43      data_[i] = val;
 44  }
 45
 46  ~Dense_storage()
 47  {
 48    // user's responsiblity to call deallocate().
 49    if (alloc_data_)
 50      assert(data_ == 0);
 51  }
 52
 53  T    get(index_type idx) const { return data_[idx];}
 54  void put(index_type idx, T val){ data_[idx] = val;}
 55
 56  T &ref(index_type idx) { return data_[idx];}
 57  T const &ref(index_type idx) const { return data_[idx];}
 58
 59  type data() { return data_;}
 60  const_type data() const { return data_;}
 61
 62  /// Rebind the memory referred to by Dense_storage object
 63  ///
 64  /// Requires:
 65  ///   :size: size object was constructed with.
 66  void rebind(Memory_pool* pool, length_type size, type buffer)
 67  {
 68    if (buffer)
 69    {
 70      if (alloc_data_) pool->deallocate<T>(data_, size);
 71      alloc_data_ = false;
 72      data_       = buffer;
 73    }
 74    else // (buffer == 0
 75    {
 76      if (!alloc_data_)
 77      {
 78	alloc_data_ = true;
 79	data_ = pool->allocate<T>(size);
 80      }
 81      /* else do nothing - we already own our data */
 82    }
 83  }
 84
 85  void deallocate(Memory_pool* pool, length_type size)
 86  {
 87    if (alloc_data_)
 88    {
 89      pool->deallocate(data_, size);
 90      data_ = 0;
 91      alloc_data_ = false;
 92    }
 93  }
 94
 95  bool is_alloc() const { return alloc_data_; }
 96
 97private:
 98  bool   alloc_data_;
 99  T*     data_;
100};
101
102template <typename T>
103class Dense_storage<Cmplx_split_fmt, complex<T> >
104{
105public:
106  typedef std::pair<T*, T*>             type;
107  typedef std::pair<T const*, T const*> const_type;
108
109  Dense_storage(Memory_pool*  pool,
110		length_type   size,
111		type          buffer    = type(0, 0))
112    VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc))
113    : alloc_data_(!buffer.first || !buffer.second),
114      real_data_ (alloc_data_ ? pool->allocate<T>(size) : buffer.first),
115      imag_data_ (alloc_data_ ? pool->allocate<T>(size) : buffer.second)
116  {}
117
118  Dense_storage(Memory_pool*     pool,
119		length_type      size,
120		vsip::complex<T> val,
121		type buffer = type(0, 0))
122    VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc))
123    : alloc_data_(!buffer.first || !buffer.second),
124      real_data_ (alloc_data_ ? pool->allocate<T>(size) : buffer.first),
125      imag_data_ (alloc_data_ ? pool->allocate<T>(size) : buffer.second)
126  {
127    for (index_type i=0; i<size; ++i)
128      real_data_[i] = val.real();
129    for (index_type i=0; i<size; ++i)
130      imag_data_[i] = val.imag();
131  }
132
133  ~Dense_storage()
134  {
135    // user's responsiblity to call deallocate().
136    if (alloc_data_)
137      assert(real_data_ == 0 && imag_data_ == 0);
138  }
139
140  vsip::complex<T> get(index_type idx) const
141  { return vsip::complex<T>(real_data_[idx], imag_data_[idx]);}
142
143  void put(index_type idx, vsip::complex<T> val)
144  {
145    real_data_[idx] = val.real();
146    imag_data_[idx] = val.imag();
147  }
148
149  vsip::complex<T> &ref(index_type)
150  {
151    VSIP_IMPL_THROW(unimplemented(
152	"Dense_storage<Cmplx_split_fmt>::ref - unimplemented"));
153  }
154  vsip::complex<T> const &ref(index_type) const
155  {
156    VSIP_IMPL_THROW(unimplemented(
157	"Dense_storage<Cmplx_split_fmt>::ref - unimplemented"));
158  }
159
160  type data() { return type(real_data_, imag_data_);}
161  const_type data() const { return const_type(real_data_, imag_data_);}
162
163  /// Rebind the memory referred to by Dense_storage object
164  ///
165  /// Requires:
166  ///   :size: size object was constructed with.
167  void rebind(Memory_pool* pool, length_type size, type buffer)
168  {
169    if (buffer.first && buffer.second)
170    {
171      if (alloc_data_)
172      {
173	pool->deallocate(real_data_, size);
174	pool->deallocate(imag_data_, size);
175      }
176      alloc_data_ = false;
177      real_data_  = buffer.first;
178      imag_data_  = buffer.second;
179    }
180    else
181    {
182      if (!alloc_data_)
183      {
184	alloc_data_ = true;
185	real_data_ = pool->allocate<T>(size);
186	imag_data_ = pool->allocate<T>(size);
187      }
188      /* else do nothing - we already own our data */
189    }
190  }
191
192  void deallocate(Memory_pool* pool, length_type size)
193  {
194    if (alloc_data_)
195    {
196      pool->deallocate(real_data_, size);
197      pool->deallocate(imag_data_, size);
198      real_data_ = 0;
199      imag_data_ = 0;
200      alloc_data_ = false;
201    }
202  }
203
204  bool is_alloc() const { return alloc_data_;}
205
206private:
207  bool   alloc_data_;
208  T*     real_data_;
209  T*     imag_data_;
210};
211
212} // namespace vsip::impl
213} // namespace vsip

215#endif
